qas.question: Who did Kerry's staff expose in an Oct 14 report?
Who had Oliver North been supporting?
What government agencies worked with North?

answers.text: the National Security Council and the CIA

qas.question: What crime had Kerry said North committed?

answers.text: illegally funding and supplying armed militants without the authorization of Congress

context: Meanwhile, Kerry's staff began their own investigations and, on October 14, issued a report that exposed illegal activities on the part of <a0_0>Lieutenant Colonel Oliver North<a0_0/>, who had set up a private network involving <a3_0>the National Security Council and the CIA<a3_0/> to deliver military equipment to <a1_0><a2_0>right-wing Nicaraguan rebels<a2_0/> (Contras)<a1_0/>. In effect, North and certain members of the President's administration were accused by Kerry's report of <a4_0>illegally funding and supplying armed militants without the authorization of Congress<a4_0/>. Kerry's staff investigation, based on a year-long inquiry and interviews with fifty unnamed sources, is said to raise "serious questions about whether the United States has abided by the law in its handling of the contras over the past three years."
